Posts.Content: Jan 10, 2012 08:15PM Sonant wrote: I hope this does get printed and published.  I have a four year old granddaughter.  All she knows is that her "Grammy" is sick.  Children would love to have something this special.  Thank you Apple for suggesting this project.
Posts.Title: a thread of gold apple GatorGal

Posts.Content: Sonant wrote: I am headed for surgery on January 27, 2012.  It is positive for a mastectomy on my right side.  I will be my decision to have a mastectomy on the left.  We have found a small area on the left that will be closely monitored.  My biopsy was negetive for cancer.  I have to go in six months for another biopsy, mamograms etc...  It was explained to me that my chances of cancer occuring in the left will be less but not guaranteed.  Cancer runs in my family.  Grandmother had breast cancer too.  And this is my second bout with cancer.  Had it twenty years ago.  Cervical. I think I would like just to have peace of mind knowing that I won't have to do the rounds of biopsies, x-rays and lumpectomies.  I say let the healing begin.  I won't know about chemo or radiation until after pathology reports.  Do know I am headed for ht.   How about it ladies?  Has anybody else sailed in this boat? Dx 11/7/2011, IDC, 1cm, Stage I, Grade 3, 0/2 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Need to your advice, love and support. Sonant Sonant

Posts.Content: Feb 14, 2012 03:02PM Sonant wrote: Wednesday I had my drains removed.  They couldn't fill my TEs though.  They said I had too much bruising still.  Was also prescribed some muscle relaxer.  My chest muscles are having spasms.  Is this normal?  I also have a tingling sensatation.  Haven't heard yet about my treatments.  My appointment with my surgeon isn't until the 20th.  I would like to know something now.  Was told my results would be ready a week after surgery.  Did have at 2 nodes removed.  How are you doing Jenn and Joan?
Posts.Title: Need to your advice, love and support. Sonant Sonant

Posts.Content: Apr 21, 2012 10:01PM Sonant wrote: Hi there, Just checking in to see how everyone is feeling.
Posts.Title: Need to your advice, love and support. Sonant Sonant

Posts.Content: May 20, 2012 02:17PM Sonant wrote: Hello all! How are we doing?  I am now in my second week of Taxol.  Ten more weeks to go.
Posts.Title: Need to your advice, love and support. Sonant Sonant

Posts.Content: Jan 18, 2012 12:31AM Sonant wrote: Ok JennL, Didn't know that they would start filling the TE's after surgery.  Going to ask my ps about that!  It's the first I have heard of that.  I think this is exactly what we need to do.  It's all a new experience and something worth sharing.  I can't talk to my female relatives.. I am the only one I know of going through this.  And thank you Joan for sharing.  I am so glad I am not alone!
Posts.Title: Need to your advice, love and support. Sonant Sonant

Posts.Content: Jan 18, 2012 10:31PM Sonant wrote: Joan, I did check out caringbridges.  My son is going to be my communication guy.  We both have facebook.  He plans on keeping family, friends and church updated through these websites.  Thanks for the tips too.  Found some clothing to wear from the hospital and around the house.  Sweats that button down the front and pull on pants to match.  I found on-line silk lounge wear that also buttons down the front.  My Mom also brought me silk pj's.  Do have a question for you.  How long were you in the hospital and did you use a pillow on your chest when wearing a seat belt for your ride home?  I have an hour and fifteen minutes from my house to the hospital.  JennL, Hope you don't mind but I have you on my prayer list.  Actually since my diagnosis, I have been praying for all who are like us.
Posts.Title: Need to your advice, love and support. Sonant Sonant

Posts.Content: Feb 4, 2012 11:24AM Sonant wrote: I did it!.  On the mend and have been doing pretty good.  Have my family here.  Coming and going and helping with meals.  My sister in law made the most amazing chicken pot pie.  The pain medication is helping.  Have two drains. On Tuesday have my first appointment.  Question.  If you have TE's do they do radiation?  Can they do radiation with them in?
Posts.Title: Need to your advice, love and support. Sonant Sonant

Posts.Content: Jan 16, 2012 10:14PM Sonant wrote: JoanQuilts, How are you feeling? Got any advice for this one headed for this?  Would love to hear from the rest of you also.  Tips, pointers and prayers would be appreciated.
Posts.Title: Need to your advice, love and support. Sonant Sonant

Posts.Content: Jan 20, 2012 07:49PM Sonant wrote: Had my pre-op today.  Everything is good so far.  Next Friday is surgery.  The wait is almost over!
Posts.Title: Need to your advice, love and support. Sonant Sonant

Posts.Content: Jan 25, 2012 10:02PM Sonant wrote: Ok ladies, Friday is my surgery.  I am prepared and looking forward to getting rid a diseased breast.  I have decided to do a bi-lateral.  Starting new with diseased free, perky young breast.  I think I am getting the best deal!  When I am home and depending on how I feel,  I will give you an update.  Please keep me in thought and prayer.  Surgery is scheduled for 7:30 am.
Posts.Title: Need to your advice, love and support. Sonant Sonant

Posts.Content: Feb 15, 2012 01:28PM Sonant wrote: Hi Kelley, I am at peace with my decision.  After posting my thread,  I have found  alot of ladies that had to make the same decision.   I also talked alot with my nurses on my team.  Amazing how many of them had breast cancer too.  Many of them had the single mastectomy and wished they had chosen the bi-lateral months or years after their surgeries.  I had my first fill in my TE's today.  I am doing better than I expected.  I will find out on Monday what my treatment will be.  Hang in there and I will add you to my prayers.
Posts.Title: Need to your advice, love and support. Sonant Sonant

Posts.Content: Mar 5, 2012 07:01PM Sonant wrote: My oncologist is recommending chemo.  Starting Thursday.  My cocktail is Adriamycin and Cytoxan. Will be doing this for 6 treatments.  Every other week and then I start every week on another drug.  But I can't remember the name of that.  Had a port put in last Thursday.  Is anyone out there on the same treatment and if so,  how are you doing with it?  I was told that my hair would fall out and that I may be queasy and nauseous.  My incision is healing and I have been going for my TE fills.  Can't have them removed though.  I have to watch my white count and it's not recommanded for surgery.  That stinks.  Oh well, one day at a time.  How is everyone else?
Posts.Title: Need to your advice, love and support. Sonant Sonant

Posts.Content: Apr 4, 2012 09:48PM Sonant wrote: Hi JennL, Yes I got a port.  This is a great way to get treatment without trying to tap into a vein that can weaken because to chemo.  It's not too bad either.  My second treat was not to bad.  Like you, I have been tired and drained of energy.  When I do have some energy I make the best of it! My chemo cockatail is adriamycin and cytoxan.  Tomorrow will be my third treatment and in two weeks my last for this combination.  Then for next twelve weeks will be taxol.  I will go every week for that one. I did lose all my hair and my wig had to be sent back for a alteration.  The scarves are more comfortable anyway.  My hubby has treated me to a special skin care products made by John Hopkins for chem patients.  I can't tell you how much I love the stuff.  My skin is so dry and this stuff is amazing. Hopeing all is well with everyone.  Keep us posted.  Hope to hear from you Joan. Prayers to all!
Posts.Title: Need to your advice, love and support. Sonant Sonant

Posts.Content: Apr 22, 2012 10:41PM Sonant wrote: Sounds like we all have been tired.  Couldn't do my 4th chemo on Thursday.  My red blood count was so low that on Friday I had to have a blood transfusion.  Doing better today.  Will try again on Thursday for chemo.  It will be the last for phase one.  I will start Taxol for 12 weeks. As for my skin care products.  They are formulated by John Hopkins.  Here is the website.  www.imagerecovery.com  The products I bought are the following:  Chamomile Cleansing Lotion, Calming Bio-Lipid Repair Fluid and Hydra Gel Skincare Intense.  I really like how my skin feels.  It looks really good now too. Hope this helps you.  Will keep praying for us all.
Posts.Title: Need to your advice, love and support. Sonant Sonant

Posts.Content: Feb 6, 2012 06:10PM Sonant wrote: No JennL.  Not sure what course of action I will be taking.  Waiting on my pathologist report.  Was told if I had just a lumpectomy I would be having radiation.  Surgeon said too much breast would be taken.  Mastectomy was my best option.  Now just waiting.  Wednesday my drains and incision will be checked.

Posts.Content: Feb 19, 2012 10:14AM Sonant wrote: Thank you Joan and Mom of 3boys! After having my TE's filled, I started thinking it was a mistake.  Muscle spasms increased and my ribs really hurt.  I had been kicked by a horse 3 years ago and she bruised and cracked a rib.  I felt like I was kicked again.  And yes I am feeling the ex-panders.  I go again on Wednesday for another fill and this Monday I see my BS.  Hopefully I will get my answers and course of treatment.  I am experiencing a tingle sensation.  Hope that is a sign of healing.  And I will take my muscle relaxer.  Want to heal as fast as possible.I have been trying to "suck it up"  and not use alot of meds.  Good thing I found this thread!
Posts.Title: Need to your advice, love and support. Sonant Sonant

Posts.Content: Mar 15, 2012 07:30PM Sonant wrote: Hi Ladies, Had my first chemo last thursday.  Was checking on the rest to see how everyone is doing.  How are you JennL and Joan?
Posts.Title: Need to your advice, love and support. Sonant Sonant

Posts.Content: Mar 21, 2012 10:07PM Sonant wrote: Not doing to bad Joan.  My second chemo will be tomorrow.  My first one was a trip!  My chemos are scheduled two weeks apart.  I go to my first one on March 8th which was a Thursday.  My shot on Friday.  I thought, cool, only slightly queasy.  Then I slept thur Saturday and most of Sunday.  Monday and Tuesday I felt awful.  I called my nurse and she said that I caught a stomach virus and everybody that had treatment on that Thursday.     I have been feeling better and hope I do better next treatment.  My hair has started falling out.  I did get my hair cut short.  I didn't have the heart to do a buzz cut.  I have a wig fitting on Friday.  Looking into some scarves and hats too. How about you Joan.  Do you still have your hair?  I am really surprised that losing my hair isn't such a big deal.  My hubby and family have been very supportive.  Hope all is well with everyone else.  Prayers to all. Keep us posted on your progress!
Posts.Title: Need to your advice, love and support. Sonant Sonant

Posts.Content: Mar 5, 2012 11:36PM Sonant wrote: My oncologist told me of different chemicals for chemo and helped decide which one would be the best for me.  My DH has been going to every appointment with me.  He also has been able to help me make my decisions.  Did anyone else have a port installed for their chemo treatments?
